ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: electric fields, electrophoresis, electric interactions, capacitors, pipetting, and reaction kinetics
How physics principles apply to biological research techniques.
lab skills regarding Biophysics
Understanding of electromagnetic theory, application of electromagnetic theory to biology, light and biomolecules interaction, experimental design, statistical analysis
I learned a lot of interesting skills and techniques in the context of a physics laboratory with lots of interesting insights into applications in living systems. Super cool!
An overview to introductory physics lab topics including balloon charges, light optics, pippeting, and more.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: the teaching team are all very kind and passionate, you learn about many different topics, the work is mostly (if not completely) done in class

Weaknesses: since we cover so many different topics, you should not expect to learn in-depth about many aspects of physics - it's more of an introduction to physics lab and topics

Strengths: a great way to get your physics lab requirements in a shorter time period. Also had occasional guest speakers which as very beneficial for our learning.
Weaknesses: often ran out of time to finish labs in one session (so ran into other sessions, which we were given time for so it did not make things more stressful). Maybe next time just ensure there is enough time to complete a lab in one session, or structure the labs so that they can be completed in one session.
everything is good. just a little bit more organization
Great course, no work outside of class, low stress and you learn a lot

Strengths: self-directed nature of the experiments, flexibility to work in groups, accessible teaching team, weekend office hours, reasonable workload, guest speakers, Yale lab tours. Weaknesses: absolutely none, this course was amazing!

This course was awesome in that I felt much more engaged with the material because I didn't feel that I was constantly fighting to keep up with work or achieve a certain grade. I really appreciated how most of the workload fell within the class period, as it kept me super engaged during class time. We covered such interesting topics and the course was well-organized for a first-time class.
The course is very well organized and suited for student improvement and exploration. The assignments and labs are fun and creative!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course. I had a great experience this semester with the teaching team and felt that we covered many physics topics in a way that was understandable to a total beginner (like me).
Yes, if they need to meet a physics lab requirement and they are a more bio-oriented student.
yes
Yes, take this lab

Yes!! This course is a welcoming environment for students interested in applying physics to biology and learning more about fundamental physics lab techniques. Best lab course I have taken at Yale thus far!! Professor Schilling and the teaching team were amazing!!

I would absolutely recommend this course to other students. Super fascinating material, great teaching crew, a full credit for a semester of lab (combined with 121L), and great skills developed for a future in research or medicine.
Yes
Yes! This is a great intro course suited for both STEM and non-STEM majors. The professors are very accommodating for students of all backgrounds.
